column5: Corey and I finally got out on the ice for the first time in 2007.  Was dying to try our new hut as well as some recently acquired equipment.      It was pretty chilly but not too windy.  The bite wasn't overly strong but we didn't get skunked, a few small fellas who are still swimming but it was sure nice to get out.  There was probably about 8 inches of ice.  Anyways a few pics from the day....  Getting set up...   This one turn out pretty good...a cold morning sky....   The new hut....   I'm really happy with my float suit....   Here's a shot from the toque cam....   Mistyjr.....   Thanks for reading.
Very nice report Misty.  You look well equipped for a day out on the ice.  Congrats to you and your son.  Where were you fishing?  Corn Nug

Glad you made it out. That second shot is amazing with the fisher people in the background and that cloudy sky with the sun breaking through. Looks like a group meeting out there with the gatherings.  dsn

Looks like a good time and that's a great shot out across the ice.  Love those scenery shots and you captured the moment very nicely.  Glad to see some folks are finally able to get out for some hard-water action.   You got all that gear tested out.  The next time, you'll fill that little white bucket.
We got the same hut and I used it for the first time Saturday and Sunday and just love it.  Thanks for the report.  Joey
great report seems everyone is getting out
nice report and great pics,looks like you 2 had a great time and well,you guys caught a few at least you got to try out the new equiptment...cheers

Thanks for the replies folks.   Corn Nug, we were fishing out of Gilford.  I forgot to mention, as we were coming off the ice, there was a CO there checking licences.    Told him it was good to see him there.  Had a nice chat with Peter of Ice Cabins as well.  Jim
